Iranian President Supports Korean People's Struggle for Reunification
articles.content:
Iranian President Supports Korean People's Struggle for Reunification 
    Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- I wish the Korean people greater success in their efforts for the country's prosperity and reunification in the new
year, said Iranian President Seyed Mohammad Khatami when meeting with the DPRK ambassador to the country on Feb. 9.
 He said that the government and people of Iran fully support the government and people of the DPRK in their efforts to preserve the peace and security of the country and would make every possible effort to boost the traditional friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.content:
Hanchongryon Chairman Flails U.S. Hostile Moves toward North
    Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of sympathy to Hugo�@Chavez�@Frias, president of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, on Feb. 16 for the heavy losses in human lives and materials caused by torrential rain and flood which hit different areas of the country.
 The message expressed deep sympathy to the president, government and people of the republic and sincerely hoped that its government would remove the consequences of the disaster and bring the living of the people in the afflicted areas back to normal conditions at an early date.
